lead_paragraph: PECK--Robert. Robert Beryl Peck, died peacefully at home on January 23, 2016. Born December 24, 1924 to Joseph and Mary Peck, he was raised in New Rochelle, NY and graduated from New Rochelle High School. A longtime resident of Chappaqua, NY, he was married for 56 years to Jane Reiffel Peck who predeceased him. He lived a full and interesting life filled with happiness and love and always considered himself to be a lucky man. After serving in the US Navy, he graduated from The University of Michigan and earned a graduate degree from Columbia University. During his career as a stockbroker and member of The New York Stock Exchange, he was a co-founder and partner at Kahn, Peck & Company and later a Managing Director at Burnham Securities. A great believer in community service, he gave generously of his time and served on the board of The New Castle Historical Society, The Chappaqua Library, The Horace Greeley Education Fund, The New Castle Board of Architectural Review and was a board member at Human Development Services of Westchester, a charitable organization his parents helped found in 1968 as Futura House. Bob Peck was a devoted family man who, along with his beloved Jane, played an active role in the lives of his children and grandchildren. Always looking forward to the next adventure, he was an avid pilot of his Cherokee Six, competitive tennis player, fine craftsman and woodworker, lifelong sailor and world traveler. He was a longtime member of The University Club. He leaves three daughters: Lisa MacPhail and husband, Allen MacPhail, Amy Peck and husband, Ralph Sinsheimer, Susan Kineke and husband, Paul Kineke. Pop-Pop to his eight grandchildren: Lucy MacPhail, Bryan MacPhail (Allison Butler MacPhail), Kate MacPhail, Max Sinsheimer, Ted Sinsheimer, Molly Sinsheimer, Emily Kineke and Jay Kineke and his great-grandchildren: William, Lila, Jane, Georgia, Hadley and Graham MacPhail. He also leaves his sister, Emily Halpern and many nieces, nephews and cousins. He will be missed. In lieu of flowers, a donation to Human Development Services of Westchester in Robert Peck's memory would be greatly appreciated by the family. HDSW, 930 Mamaroneck Avenue, Mamaroneck, NY 10543. 1/3
